book.title: GT version GridShib : System Administrator's Guide

abstract.title: Introduction
abstract.para: This guide contains advanced configuration information for system administrators working with GridShib. It provides references to information on procedures typically performed by system administrators, including installation, configuring, deploying, and testing the installation.

important.simpara: The information in this GridShib Admin Guide is in addition to the basic Globus Toolkit prerequisite, overview, installation, security configuration instructions in the . Read through this guide before continuing!

chapter.title: Building and Installing
chapter.para: GridShib is build and installed with the Globus Toolkit by default, nothing more need be done.

section.title: Deploying at the Container Level
section.para:
To deploy GridShib for a GT4 container:
Edit the file $GLOBUS_LOCATION/etc/globus_wsrf_core/global_security_descriptor.xml
Add an authz element inside the securityConfig element with an attribute of value=org.globus.gridshib.GridShibPDP
If the file $GLOBUS_LOCATION/etc/globus_wsrf_core/global_security_descriptor.xml does not exist, create it in its entirety as shown above.

section.title: Deploying at the Service Level
section.para:
To deploy GridShib for a particular service:
Edit the security configuration file for the service. For example, for GRAM the file is $GLOBUS_LOCATIONetc/gram-service/managed-job-factory-security-config.xml
Comment out the existing authz element if it exists.
Add an authz element inside the securityConfig element with an attribute of value=org.globus.gridshib.GridShibPDP

GRAM deployment # In etc/gram-service/managed-job-factory-security-config.xml, comment out the existing <authz> element and add a new <authz> element:
<securityConfig xmlns="http://www.globus.org"> <method name="createManagedJob"> <auth-method> <GSITransport/> <GSISecureMessage/> <GSISecureConversation/> </auth-method> </method> <!--<authz value="gridmap"/>--> <authz value="gram:org.globus.gridshib.GridShibPDP"/> <reject-limited-proxy value="true"/> </securityConfig>
Note that if you are adding GridShib to GRAM you need to modify /etc/sudoers as outlined in the GT4 GRAM Admin Guide. (??? modified how exactly ???)
